title: Mark Harper – 2023 Statement on Plans for New Smart Motorways Cancelled
author: admin
summary: The statement made by Mark Harper, the Secretary of State for Transport, in the House of Commons on 17 April 2023.
content:
The government has announced that all plans for new smart motorways have been cancelled.
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers
  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association
  *[BATA]: British Air Transport Association
  *[OECD]: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[PISA]: Programme for International Student Assessment
  *[PIRLS]: Progress in International Reading Literacy Study
  *[TIMSS]: Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
  *[DCMS]: Department for Digital Culture Media & Sport
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[HR]: human resources
  *[NASBM]: National Association of School Business Management
  *[CAMHS]: Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services
  *[EPPSE]: Effective pre-school, primary and secondary education
  *[LAs]: local authorities
  *[PVIs]: private, voluntary and independents
  *[UNDP]: United Nations Development Programme
  *[BIT]: Behavioural Insights Team

This will mean that the 11 schemes already paused from the [second Road Investment Strategy (2020 to 2025)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/road-investment-strategy-2-ris2-2020-to-2025) and the 3 earmarked for construction during the [third Road Investment Strategy (2025 to 2030)](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/preparing-the-third-road-investment-strategy) will be removed from the government’s road-building plans in recognition of the current lack of public confidence felt by drivers and cost pressures.
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product
  *[UCL]: University College London
  *[HIV]: human immunodeficiency virus
  *[AI]: artificial intelligence
  *[ABI]: Association of British Insurers
  *[CMU]: Capital Markets Union
  *[IMO]: International Maritime Organization
  *[MARPOL]: International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships.
  *[UK]: United Kingdom
  *[IGF]: International Code of Safety for Ships using Gases or other Low-flashpoint Fuels
  *[COP]: Paris Climate Conference
  *[AOA]: The Airport Operators Association
  *[BATA]: British Air Transport Association
  *[OECD]: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development
  *[PISA]: Programme for International Student Assessment
  *[PIRLS]: Progress in International Reading Literacy Study
  *[TIMSS]: Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study
  *[DCMS]: Department for Digital Culture Media & Sport
  *[CEOs]: chief executive officers
  *[HR]: human resources
  *[NASBM]: National Association of School Business Management
  *[CAMHS]: Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services
  *[EPPSE]: Effective pre-school, primary and secondary education
  *[LAs]: local authorities
  *[PVIs]: private, voluntary and independents
  *[UNDP]: United Nations Development Programme
  *[BIT]: Behavioural Insights Team

While no new stretches will be converted, work on the M56 J6 to J8 and M6 J21a to J26 will go ahead as planned given they are already over three-quarters constructed.
  *[ISIL]: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant
  *[SDGs]: Sustainable Development Goals
  *[IMF]: International Monetary Fund
  *[UN]: United Nations
  *[GDP]: Gross Domestic Product

  *[LAs]: local authorities
  *[PVIs]: private, voluntary and independents
  *[UNDP]: United Nations Development Programme
  *[BIT]: Behavioural Insights Team

The government and National Highways will continue to invest £900 million in further safety improvements on existing smart motorways. This includes installing stopped vehicle detection technology on every all lane running smart motorway which has now been completed, adding an additional 150 emergency areas across the network by 2025 and investing in giving motorists clear advice when using existing smart motorways.

The government will also continue to deliver against its other commitments as set out in its response to the Transport Select Committee in January 2022.

This government will continue to ensure that our roads remain among the safest in the world – helping drivers not just to be safe, but crucially, to feel safe and confident when driving.
